problems.title: Count Frequency of Elements using Hash Map
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of N integers. Using a hash map, count the frequency of each element.
Print each unique element and its frequency in the order of their first occurrence.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
7
1 2 1 3 2 1 4

Sample Output
1 3
2 2
3 1
4 1

Explanation:
1 appears 3 times, 2 appears 2 times, 3 appears 1 time, 4 appears 1 time.

starterCodes.code:

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split()
    N = int(data[0])
    arr = list(map(int, data[1:]))
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.countFrequency(arr)
    for item in result:
        print(item[0], item[1])

hintsList: Use a hash map to count occurrences. Keep track of insertion order.
In languages without ordered maps, maintain a separate list for first occurrence order.
